summary:
I work like a detective. I deeply investigate issues, uncover the troubles, provide solutions & make sure I build long-term customer relationships. I create business cases & add value to the sales force & management. I translate customers’ complex problems into meaningful sights & forward them to different stakeholders. To accomplish this, I focus on analysis before execution, build a reputation among peers through teamwork & quickly adopt detailed insights. 

I am working in the competitive high-tech industry with a special emphasis on customer support.
 - I support new product/platform introduction (NPI) to the customers who are at the center of all
 - I work as an interface between field organisations & different internal sectors

I effectively create & scale businesses of a few thousand to millions in revenue.
 - I helped customers in deploying new products & provide the optimal business solution
 - I offered a scaling solution that can be addressed by the product portfolio

I aim to be the better version of myself.
 - I have built my reputation as a technical problem solver & a businesslike attitude within the company in a short time frame in such a way that now people listen & value my opinions very considerately
 - I am said to be the most adaptive to fit the necessity required, I say I am vastly diverse to embrace myself into any situation

Apart from my job, I am engaged in technology innovation projects (eg. Semi-Finalist at Philips Innovation Award) which allows me to gain knowledge of a wide variety of real-life applications & established myself as an innovative problem solver. Let’s talk if you want to discuss innovation, entrepreneurship, or car!

In a nutshell, I am:
• rational & businesslike
• detailed & customer-oriented
• concrete & strongly opinionated on how things should be done in time & tune 

Domain Expertise:
• New Product Introduction, Escalation Lead, Network Design, Telecommunication, PON, Linux, & AGILE Scrum methodology
• Product development, team development & business development
• Customer support, strategic planning & stakeholder management

projects.title: TGiM (Thanks God It's Monday)
projects.description: Developed an innovative algorithm which involves machine learning and complex analytics such as sentimental analysis from social network mining and offers B2B to companies who are having issues with unengaged employees and are looking for the right person for their jobs. The service creates two separate revenue streams: Companies are charged for detailed interior mood reviews and potential talents suggestions while the innovative matching algorithm is provided to other systems such as CRM systems.

contributors.headline: Scientific Developer / Postdoctoral Researcher @ GhentCDH | Digital Humanities | Applied Machine Learning

projects.title: Shading and Rendering of Virtual Character
projects.description:
Click the heading to view the video.
This project concerns the realistic rendering of virtual characters, involving the use of a custom skin shader and sophisticated lighting techniques in the Unity engine. It was a part of the project “Emotion Crowd” at KTH Campus for implementing realistic human character in the scene. I developed a compatible custom shader in Unity which can be applied to any human character to get the realistic effect.
In my custom shader I put the following adjustment options:
1. Specular Power
2. Fresnel Value
3. Curvature Scale
4. Blur Bias
5. Alpha Cutoff
I started with the Head Model to see the effect of every adjustment. Next, I put the Stacy Model to examine the effects with my custom shader. In order to get a better result in Stacy Model, I had to adjust the normal map by creating from Grayscale and reducing the Bumpiness.
As a dynamic addition to my work, I demonstrated Image Based Lighting (IBL) effect in my human character models. I brought HDR image in my scene and then I generated Cube Maps from the HDR image using Skyshop. Skyshop takes HDR images (panoramas, crosses, or cubemaps) as input and generates diffuse and specular IBL Cube Maps from them. Along with the IBL tools, Skyshop comes with all the permutations of shaders and material types from Marmoset Toolbag. It is a very useful tool to work with.
This is a project work of the course DH2323 Computer Graphics and Interaction at KTH, Sweden under Professor Christopher Peters.
For more insight into the project please visit:
https://portfolio-mskhan.rhcloud.com/category/dh2323/

projects.description: Created a Transfer Function that maps attribute scalar values to opacity for explicit volume rendering of 3D grid data obtained from CT Scan and MRI. Paraview is used as the platform.

projects.title: Innovation & Entrepreneurship Master Thesis
projects.description:
"RealCon"
An innovative business model for a real-time concussion detector is developed through out-of-the-building market research, direct interviews with potential customers, partners, and channels. Extended relevant research and potential entrepreneurial aspects with attractive value propositions are proposed that can be implemented in a large scale business. Proposed an implementation plan for 12 months supplemented with a financial projection that is explicitly aimed at establishing the business in the market for motorbike riders. 
- Achieved the highest grade in the class for the thesis.

projects.title: A Comparatively Fast and Accurate Coherent Point Drift Registration Algorithm Implemented in Python
projects.description: In this project, the Python implementation for Coherent Point Drift (CPD) algorithm is carried out with the collaboration of the Clinical Graphics (a software company in the medical field). Implementing CPD in Python is novel and never done before. We compared the quality of our Python algorithm to Procrustes and ICP algorithms. The Python CPD shows good results and outperformed the other methods. We implemented the Coherent Point Drift in a pure python version without calling other programming language functions and built the excellent algorithm that can be directly used in the production level. In addition to this, we optimized our Python CPD by replacing almost all the codes in the function calculating matrix (vectorization) which highly improved the efficiency of the Python CPD and made it almost the same and sometimes even faster than the counterpart C mex function in the original Matlab program.

projects.title: Corporate Venturing in Philips
projects.description: Different aspects of Corporate Entrepreneurship (CE) in Koninklijke Philips N.V. (Royal Philips) are investigated both from the empirical and theoretical perspectives. As a strategic management consultant, how Philips nurtures the CE culture, how CE effects the global sustainability of Philips and how Philips evolves with the changes and demands of the markets are debated. From extensive research, we had the opportunity to get a good insight into the entrepreneurial activities of Philips and we made some suggestions for the improvements while maintaining their existing market strategy since they need to adopt new culture to ensure their sustained growth for the future market at the same time. In fact, big companies must investigate, generate, develop, and sustain innovative new businesses.

projects.title: Image Registration and Optic Flow
projects.description: Studying the most widely used Lucas-Kanade (LK) registration algorithm, its implementation, restriction, improvements and relating to other methods are carried out in this project. We used Matlab and DIPImage toolbox along with some other test images in order to study the behavior of the techniques, make comparisons, and to implement the techniques for real-world image data.

projects.title: Concussion Detector in Amateur Boxing
projects.description: Developed a real-time concussion detector which involves Internet of Things (IoT) technology. In this project, pro-micro, force sensors (FSR), and a Bluetooth module are integrated to work along with a graphical user interface (GUI) in order to make the device fully functional and remote.

company.name: Embassy of Bangladesh, The Hague, Netherlands

volunteer_experiences.description:
Organized the seminar on "Dutch-Bangla Bridge in the ICT sector" and showcased my presentation on "Road to Digital Bangladesh: Opportunities, Challenges & Prospects" at the Embassy of Bangladesh, Netherlands.
Featured in daily national: http://www.prothomalo.com/durporobash/article/1448156

Portrayed: 
- A comparison between Dutch and Bangladesh government in e-government policy implementation and how Bangladesh government can learn from the Dutch government in digitalizing
- How the Netherlands and Bangladesh can enhance collaboration in ICT sector?
- How can the Dutch ICT companies extend cooperation to Bangladesh and Bangladeshi ICT expat community living in the Netherlands in terms of entrepreneurship development, human resource development, and technology transfer?
- How to initiate "start-up" consultation/programs between Dutch ventures and Bangladeshi start-up community such as startupdhaka.org (together with ICT Division, Bangladesh)?
- What type of support does the community need from Bangladesh govt/embassy to take an initiative in the Netherlands for ICT collaboration between the community and Bangladesh?
- How to contribute positive flow individually within the community in order to grow faster and engage expert people more effectively
- What Bangladesh can do, how the expats in the Netherlands can contribute

Proposed: 
- Make a bridge/platform between Bangladeshi ICT expats community in the Netherlands and IT sectors (both public and private) in Bangladesh
- An "Innovation Hub" for Bangladeshi expats, investors, and mentors hosted by the Embassy of Bangladesh in the Netherlands
- Awareness raising among Bangladeshi community and Bangladesh government
